column1: full outside off, 123kph, left alone
shorter in length, at off stump, defended on the toes to the off side
wider outside off, 123kph, left alone...just some gentle movement
full, wide outside off, another sighter for Warner who allows it through
full outside off, big stride forward by Warner and a huge shout of 'no run' as it goes to cover
full, wide outside off, floats through to the keeper...quiet opening over all round
terrific start! Full outside off, swings back and beats the inside edge as Burns plays a big drive
well bowled again! This one is pushed across on a good length at off stump, Burns playing a defensive shot this time and is beaten
a fraction wider outside off, full, left alone
good length at off stump, 138kph, defended to mid-on
much fuller, outside off at 133kph, left alone
gets forward to a full delivery outside off, pushed with an open face to point. Very good over
back of a length outside off, Warner across the crease and defends to backward point
good length outside off, 127kph, nice carry through to Rizwan
that goes a bit wrong, dragged very wide outside off, close to being called
edgy! But he and Australia are off the mark. Stretches forward to a full delivery outside off, playing away from his body, squirts through backward point
full, angled in at off stump, plays forward and defends to mid-on
good length outside off, 127kph, defended to cover
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended on the back foot to the off side
very nicely played, leans into a half volley outside off and drives it through the covers

got him, caught behind! That's superbly bowled by Afridi. In the channel outside off stump, brings Burns forward, he's watching for the one that shapes back, and it's a regulation edge that is nicely taken by Rizwan. The no-ball is close, but he's okay

huge appeal first ball! Has Labuschagne hit the ground? They consider the review but time ticks away. Labuschagne driving at a full delivery outside off, bottom of the bat clips the ground. Daylight between bat and ball
full outside off, swishes the bat away as he leaves it alone
touch wider, another extravagant leave which Labuschagne says is part of getting him going
back of a length outside off, defended
length ball, played back to the bowler
left alone outside off
back of a length, a touch too short, Warner across outside off and plays to the on side
back of a length again, needs to get Warner on the front foot, he defends
that's better, gets it a touch fuller at off stump, Warner playing from the crease
full at off stump, 140kph, defended to mid-off
a shorter delivery, Labuschagne goes to leave it alone and is a little late, the ball runs off the face towards the slips
fuller, outside off, left alone more comfortably this time
a bouncer, first of the day, over middle and off, Labuschagne swivels as though to pull but is leaving it alone
that's a cracker as Labuschagne is beaten by a length ball that goes across him on off stump
fuller, wider outside off, through to the keeper
round the wicket, full outside off, leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, 127kph, gently through to the keeper
fuller and straighter, tucked into midwicket for a sharp single
he's right across the stumps, good job he hit that, works the delivery away from around middle and off through midwicket
length ball at off stump, walks forward and plays back to the bowler
gets squared up this time as he aims to work this through midwicket and the leading edge runs into the off side
tight run! Warner pushes a full delivery to the covers and Labuschagne gets the dive out. He would have been okay
back of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, nice carry through to the keeper but a comfortable leave and needs to keep it a touch fuller
full at off stump, defended to cover...Afridi tumbles down in his followthrough
very full at off stump, driven firmly back at the bowler who parries it away
full outside off, this one goes two bounces to the keeper
that's a super shot, strides forward into a full delivery outside off and puts it away through the covers
drags the length back, Warner gets inside the line and tucks through square leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
back over the wicket (having just said he'd been round), length ball at the stumps, defended
left alone outside off
back of a length outside off, left alone
fuller, through to the keeper
full outside off, onto the front foot and defends to the bowler
back over the wicket, on middle and off, back of a length and defended
a bouncer, over leg stump, allows it to travel over his shoulder
back of a length, pushed across outside off, left alone
over the wicket, full outside off at 136kph, driven to cover
short of a length, 136kph, Warner goes back and drops it towards point
well bowled, good delivery in the channel outside off, left alone...ah, he's overstepped and it's been called on-field
136kph, short ball, he is back and pulling without timing through midwicket but they pick up three
139kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot
136kph, bouncer, he ducks under it easily
135kph, cracking bouncer, he takes his eye off it and just gets his head out of the way
138kph, back of a length, on middle, he turns this from the back foot to short leg but can't beat him
139kph, back of a length, he stands tall on the back foot and defends
139kph. half volley, and he cracks an easy drive through cover-point! Easy pickings. Just a freebie and Warner cashes in
139kph, short and wide, he upper cuts a top edge high and safely to third and it rolls away! Another bad delivery. Warner could just thrash it up and over the cordon with minimal risk
142kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending
143kph, another wide half volley, he hammers a square drive straight to point
140kph, short ball outside off but tighter to off, Warner drops his knees and his hands to let it pass
140kph bouncer, over middle, he ducks easily
123kph, good length, wide of off, Labuschagne is on the walk but leaving
124kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves this alone
124kph, angled into leg, he clips this to square leg
123kph, good length outside off, he leaves, this bounced off a length and Rizwan parries it into his helmet! He's fine
121kph, good length, off stump, he defends from the crease
123kph, half volley angled down leg and he picks this off behind square! A gift for a Test batsman. Leg stump half volley. Labuschagne was waiting for that
140kph, short and wide, he smashes a cut shot into the ground, it bounces high and Imam jumps up at point to get a hand on it, he did well, saved four but they get two
142kph, short and wide again, he waits and places this into the gap backward of point! Musa hasn't found his length here. Warner is camping back for cut shots
145kph, fuller length, a good length, fifth stump line, he leaves and it flies through to Rizwan
142kph, bouncer, over off, he sways inside the line and keeps his hands low as he leaves
144kph, another bouncer, over off, again Warner drops his knees to sway inside it
141kph, yorker outside off, he jams down and keeps it out
124kph, good length, nipping back he defends on the front foot
121kph, good length, climbing outside off, he leaves, Rizwan doesn't take it cleanly but they don't run
126kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
124kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot to midwicket
123kph, back of a length, top of off, he's back and working this to forward square
123kph, good length, top of off, he defends from the crease
142kph, short ball, he pulls but mistimes it wide of mid on, Shaheen makes the diving stop stop
142kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he chops a cut shot to point
142kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
144kph, fuller angled in, it was tight to off but wide enough, fifth stump line, to leave
139kph, short ball, chest high, he pulls along the ground to deep square
142kph, back of a length, outside off, he's back and defending to point
121kph, length ball on leg stump, he tucks this through square leg for a single
126kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves
121kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again
123kph, too short and too wide, he's back and smoking a cut shot forward of point. Not a good delivery and Warner never misses there
126kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and across covering up in defence
127kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
137kph, short outside off, he's back and hammering a pull shot flat in the air for a fair way but short of deep square
144kph, short and fractionally wide, he late cuts with authority backward of point! Another cut shot. He's just getting gifted short wide balls and is hammering each and every one of them
back of a length wide of off, he's back and late cutting, running it to third man who is now in place
excellent pull shot between the two men in the deep! Chest high short ball, just sat up and Labuschagne swivels and places it between the two men in the deep.
142kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and leaving
over-steps, 135kph, back of a length on off, he's back with heaps of time to knock it to the gap at midwicket
over-steps again, 142kph, good length, angled across on a fourth stump line, he leaves
139kph, back of a length, on off, he's back and chopping this off the inside edge onto the body
123kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and punching through cover-point for a single, Imam does well to keep it to one
127kph, fuller on a fourth stump line, he presses forward and plays a textbook forward defence to cover
126kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
127kph, back of a length wide of off, he's leaving decisively
128kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again
125kph, shorter length, wide of off, he leaves
132kph, shorter length, on off, he's back and half whipping half pulling through square to the sweeper
133kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending, squared up a touch
135kph, good length, wider of off, he leaves
135kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's jumping back to defend
137kph, good length, he's pushing on the front foot neatly to the gap at cover-point
121kph, slower ball on off, he defends on the front foot
back of a length, he's squared up a touch defending
125kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves
126kph, back of a length, wide of off, he leaves
superb cover drive! 127kph, not a half volley but slightly over pitched and he leans forward and just strokes it between point and cover. Outstanding shot
128kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
126kph, back of a length, on off, he's squared up in defence
full outside off, 136kph, left alone with a flourish
that's a beauty as it pitches on off stump, makes him play, and nips away to beat the outside edge. Too good
pushes this even fuller, at off stump, angled across and well-judged leave with the bat well above his head. Nice start from Afridi
this draws a thick edge as he comes forward and drives at a full ball, but it runs along the ground into gully
keeps it full at off stump, driven to mid-off
well bowled again, another edge and this one squeezes between the slips and gully down to third man...Labuschagne slicing across a full delivery. Very good over
round the wicket, short of a length, Warner neatly inside the line and tucks off his hip to deep square
fuller, outside off, defended to the bowler
a fraction wider, left alone
and again, length outside off, shoulders arms...Warner has it lined up at the moment
draws him across outside off, doesn't offer a shot

touch of uncertainty this time as he plays back to a short-of-length delivery, gets an inside edge into the leg side...but then there are overthrows so he reaches fifty with a six all along the ground
beaten again, back of a length, slants across past the outside edge
middle and off, defended to cover
short of a length outside off, left alone
shorter in length, defended on the back foot to cover
back of a length, worked off the pads to square leg
very full at middle and off, neatly driven straight down the ground for a brace
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
uses the angle coming into him, worked off the pads backward of square
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
too straight, on the pads at 127kph, and that's a fantastic piece of timing with a whip through square leg
short of a length, back on off stump, defended to mid-on
on the pads again, tucked to long leg
137kph, good length, angled across, fourth stump, he leaves on length
136kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending with the full face
135kph, short ball, only chest high, he pulls powerfully along the ground to deep square
136kph, back of a length outside off, he jumps back and works this with the angle to midwicket
136kph, overpitched and he whips this beautifully through midwicket! Too full and too straight with three slips in, he pinged this off his pads through the large expanses at midwicket
139kph, better length on middle, he's caught on the crease, getting an inside edge behind square, they push for two but have to settle
128kph, fuller, he tries to drive but drags it to square leg
127kph, good length, fifth stump, he leaves this with a flourish
128kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across, getting on top of the bounce to defend
130kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave
130kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave again
128kph, good length, angled into off, he defends solidly on the front foot
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending decisively
135kph, yorker angled into off, he defends it well on the front foot
138kph, good length, off stump line, he defends from the crease
138kph, angled in, fuller, he clips this powerfully but straight to mid on
138kph, good length, but wide of off, he leaves on the front foot
136kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
128kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
127kph, back of a length, wide of off, he shuffles forward and leaves on length
angled into leg, 128kph, he glances this easily to fine leg for a single
128kph, good length, angled across the left hander, he leaves
127kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending to cover
123kph, good length, angled wide of off, he leaves watchfully
138kph, angled in to off, zeroing in on the stumps, he defends from the crease. He was hurried
139kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
142kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves again
141kph, back of a length, wide of off, he's back and cutting to backward point
138kph, short and wide, he cuts this straight to point. Labuschagne will be annoyed at missing out there
145kph, full, targeting off, he mistimes a drive to mid on
126kph, good length, angled across Warner who leaves
back of a length on middle, he's back and working this forward of square
shorter and wider, he cuts nicely but can't beat gully, nice diving save from Shafiq
shorter length, 126kph, on the hip, he glances this fine with ease
125kph, good length, on off, he defends on the front foot
126kph, good length, angled across, he leaves
143kph, good length, he leaves this alone
138kph, over-pitched wide of off, he drives nicely past cover but it's not quite middled and the outfield is wet so it slows up short of the rope
142kph, fuller length, on off, he pushes a drive straight of mid off and runs with the stroke

142kph, chest high short ball, he's back and hammering it forward of square, Imam has to dive on the rope in the deep to save four, and then he stretches Labuschagne with a decent throw but they get two
142kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves
142kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves
89kph, on leg, a hint of turn, it hurries Warner, he's taken on the thigh pad
shorter leg break on leg, he's back and tucking this to short fine
shorter again, he's down on one knee and pulling powerfully behind square, a diving stop on the rope just saves four
tossed up on off, he reaches out and defends
88kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and forcing with a vertical bat behind point
drifting into leg, 91kph, he defends on the front foot to midwicket
141kph, back of a length on off, he defends from the crease
fuller on off, he defends on the front foot to cover
141kph, good bouncer, over middle, he just sways under it late
141kph, back of a length on middle and leg, he defends from the crease
back of a length, outside off, he tries to cut but chops it off the inside edge
139kph, fuller outside off, he pushes neatly through the gap at cover-point
89kph, fuller, drifting into middle, he whips this against the turn to midwicket
tossed up on middle, he whips this square of midwicket with power! Excellent shot against the spin, timed it beautifully. Dangerous shot but well executed
drifting down leg, he glances it fine, no one is down there, Warner sprints hard and gets back for three
quicker outside off, he's back and punching this to backward point
tossed up in the arc, he's down on one knee, slog sweeping over midwicket one bounce four! it was right in the slot and he backed himself, hitting with power but control to the gap at deep midwicket
flatter and faster on leg, he's w=tucking this to midwicket
145kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves with a flourish again
magnificent late cut to bring up 50! What a shot! he sat back and late cut with great touch to place it past gully. Another half-century for Australia's new no.3
143kph, back of a length, outside off, he's jumping back and defending
141kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
141kph, back of a length, on off, he's trying to work to the on side but gets a slight leading edge
hammers a pull shot forward of square! This was emphatic. Short outside off, he was set up for the pull shot and just smacked this from waist high through forward square and didn't need to run
fuller on off, he pushes a drive to mid off
leg break dragged down leg, he leaves this alone
tossed up on leg, he pushes a drive to long on
tossed up on off, he drives to cover
shorter length, he pushes through cover point
leg break, pushed down the leg side
floated up outside off, he sits back and defends from the crease, not much turn
slower on leg, he's back and working this behind square, they immediately call for two and get them
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
shorter length, he's back and whipping this to leg but short leg is in the way
tossed up on leg, he drives straight to midwicket
floated up pitching outside leg, he kicks this away
shorter length, some turn, he's back and defending
tossed up outside leg, he pushes a drive to straight midwicket
tossed up outside off, he drives beautifully against the turn! He threaded the gap between cover and mid off, and the timing to find the rope was exquisite
pushed through on off, he's back and dabbing this to cover and they pinch a quick single. Could have been tight if the fielder was moving a little swifter
an edgy start after the interval, reaching for a full delivery and it flies to third man off a thick outside edge
back of a length outside off, defended
fuller, angled in at off stump, defended on the move to mid-off
good length, outside off, defended
keeps it on a good length, pushed back to the bowler
fuller, at off stump, clipped firmly to midwicket
pushed to midwicket with a straight bat
whipped off the pads, into short leg
round the wicket, short outside off, steps away and cuts through the off side...oh dear! The fielder, Afridi, moves the wrong way at deep cover and it's a gifted boundary
full at the stumps, defended
tucked off the pads wide of short leg
full at off stump, driven to point
punched neatly through the off side
full at off stump, searching for some swing but there isn't any, clipped to mid-on
good length at off stump, 141kph, defended to midwicket
back of a length, defended down by his feet
goes for the yorker, Warner digs out the very full delivery to the covers
round the wicket, good length outside off, another well-judged leave
short again outside off, cuts to deep cover
that's poor, another short delivery, he rocks back and drives through the covers...good chase from Afridi
round the wicket, full at off stump, a better length, driven through the covers
dragged down short, pulled strongly through midwicket...these two are quick between the wickets. That's the 150 stand
full and straight, leans forward and defends
a shorter delivery, steps back and plays to the covers
short outside off, gets on top of the bounce and guides to point
speared in full at the toes, clipped to midwicket
trying for another yorker, it's a big full toss that he forces through the on side...having run so well there's almost a mix-up
that's a good one as he comes round the wicket, hits a good length and it beats the outside edge
short of a length outside off, left alone
touch fuller, 135kph, outside off and left alone
and he brings out the reverse sweep straight away, sends this through short third man where Afridi puts in another good chase
short outside off, he rocks back but finds cover
again he plays back, this delivery was fuller, pushes to point
that's a beauty as he pitches the perfect legbreak on off stump, it spins away to beat the edge. And bounces
and now a tight leave as this one slides on outside off. Good judgement?
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
over the wicket, back of a length, defended
drop and run into the off side, excellent batting
round the wicket, back of a length, defended on the back foot
fuller, outside off, he walks across the crease then leaves alone
gets onto the front foot and drives a full delivery back to the bowler
length ball outside off, defended
flicks a full delivery to long-on
short outside off, goes onto the back foot and drives to the cover sweeper
too straight, worked off the pads backward of square
full at middle and off, Warner plays forward
goes back in the crease and whips into midwicket
short outside off, driven wide of cover
short of a length outside off, left alone...Labuschagne batting well outside the crease
length ball at off stump, defended
he's across the crease, almost walking at Abbas, works a straight delivery to square leg
at off stump, defended to mid-on...the ball has barely moved all day, except for the early exchanges
fuller, 124kph, driven to mid-off
drives a length delivery, a little on the up, finds cover. Abbas returns with a maiden
opens himself a touch, allows him to drive square through the off side, not quite enough for the boundary to reach a hundred
dragged down short outside leg stump, a wide long-hop, Warner can't connect with a sweep
full at the stumps, defended
flicked off the pads, straight to short leg on the bounce
slower, fuller, brings Warner forward
dragged down short, gets down on his back knee and plays a flat-batted sweep to deep square to reach 99
good length outside off, comes forward and pushes firmly to point...a very loud 'no' in the calling
and again, confidently forward and pushes firmly to cover
short of a length, angled to backward point...still he waits
angled across wide outside off, a tempter, left alone
short of a length, straight, worked to the leg side but no single...good pressure
wide outside off, left alone
driven a little inside-out to the left of mid-off, gives Warner the strike back
tight run, but he's done it! Another hundred, his 23rd, as he dabs a length ball to backward and sprints for the other end
tucked off the pads into midwicket
round the wicket, change of angle, defended with soft hands into the vacant slip area
forward with bat and pad together
flicked from outside off to deep midwicket
round the wicket, back of a length, beats the inside edge and deflects off the thigh pad
stretches forward and pushes to cover
back of a length at off stump, 126kph, forced into the leg side with a slight crooked bat
an appeal for lbw as Labuschagne shuffles across the crease, didn't look that close
full outside off, a lovely piece of timing with an easy push through the covers
that's a good delivery, short of a length, maybe straighten a fraction and takes an edge, near the shoulder of the bat, through the slips to third man
works with the (small) turn, flicked to short leg
dragged down short outside off, he rocks back and carves it through the covers
fuller, at the stumps, swept to deep square leg
full at off stump, driven to deep cover
another short delivery, this one is straighter and pulled to deep square
tossed up full at the stumps, whipped strongly to midwicket
over the wicket, full outside off, driven to deep point
short at off stump, crisply pulled to deep square leg. On it in flash
short again, angled in at leg stump, swivels on another superbly placed pull, this time backward of square
back of a length outside off, 142kph, pushed and run into the covers
a late cut from outside off down to third man
great wrists! This pings off the bat as he clips a full, straight delivery and finds midwicket
round the wicket, length ball at off stump, defended
full outside off, 125kph, left alone
throws his hands through a square drive between point and cover
better delivery, full at off stump, defended to mid-on
left alone outside off, barely carries to the keeper
through to the keeper
short outside off, he late cuts and finds the wide fourth slip
a bouncer over off stump, very short, lets it go through...eventually called wide
short again, this time he can get over the top of it and pulled from outside off to deep square...that's the 200-run stand
a bouncer over leg stump, Warner ducks and allows it over his back
and again, a touch shorter this time, Warner again goes underneath it
full, wide outside off, flays a drive but finds cover...the return deflects off the stumps for overthrows
drives a full delivery to mid-on
88kph, tossed up outside off, he drives inside out through cover and Shaheen chasing accidentally kicks it for four as he went to pick it up 5 metres from the rope! Goodness that is horrible
shorter length, he's back and cutting past point but he didn't time this well
short and wide, he's back in a flash and late cutting superbly! Brilliant timing and placement. Too easy
tossed up on off, he reaches out and defends
shorter length, he's back and late cutting again past slip along the ground
88kph, shorter length, he's back and punching through point
139kph, short ball, Labuschagne predicted it was coming, he cleared the front leg, was sitting back and pulling hard to deep square
139kph, skidding short ball, hip height, Warner swivels and pulls well down to fine leg
139kph, short into the ribs, cramping him, he has to jump up and knock it down. Well bowled
137kph, short down leg, he gets well inside the line and pulls to fine leg
137kph, this kicks off a length, Warner does well to control a back foot push and keep it down through point to the sweeper
135kph, high bouncer, he's back and getting the bat high above his head to pull to fine leg along the ground

advances and lofts over long off! Is it six? They need to go upstairs ... it lands millimetres short! That was so close! Just landed inside the rope. The crowd groans. What a shot though. Down the track and smashing it inside out over mid off
whipped against the turn through midwicket! Two in two for Marnus. A second Test hundred and he has arrived. What an innings. Barely an error
tossed up on off, he reaches out and defends
drifting into leg stump, he clips this beautifully through forward square! Magnificent shot but there's no sweeper back. Easy pickings
tossed up outside off, he drives on the up to mid off
shorter length, 85kph, leg break, he's back and defending
138kph, good bouncer, angling back, Warner drops the hands and sways inside it
136kph, short and fractionally wide, Warner gives room and thrashes this off the toe past gully! It wasn't controlled but he swung hard and there's only one slip in
fuller on off, he drives with ease to cover
133kph, good length angled into off, he defends getting it off the inside half of the bat past square leg, but immediately looks for two and sprints back with ease
137kph, fuller, on off, he pushes back to the bowler
116kph, slower ball on off, he's back and tucking this to midwicket
shorter leg break, he's back and mistiming this to mid off
short drag down, Warner stands there and slaps it past cover! That's a gift. The sweeper is well behind point. Easy boundary
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
tossed up on leg, he works this square of midwicket to the sweeper
a filthy short ball, he smacks a pull shot past mid on! The commentators call this buffet bowling
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover point
139kph, good length, angled in, he gets an inside edge onto pad
139kph, back of a length fourth stump, he pushes from the crease, gets an inside edge onto pad and it rolls towards point and they pinch a single
delightful late cut using the angle! 137kph, short and angled across, like a one-day shot he just leans back and runs it past gully to the vacant third man boundary
136kph, back of a length, angled into off, he defends comfortably on the back foot
134kph, bouncer outside wide of off, he just watches it go through
136kph, fuller on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
tossed up on off, he defends
flatter on off, he's back and defending
flatter on off, he defends on the front foot
drifting into middle, he defends from the crease
flatter and shorter, he's back and cutting past point
tossed up, is down and driving to long on
over-steps, back of a length wide of off, he's back and defending
136kph, short and wide, he's back and late cutting to the wide third man in place
138kph, fuller on off, he's mistiming this to mid on of the front foot
139kph full toss outside off, he checks a drive to deep cover-point
137kph, good length, angled into off, he defends from a compact position on the front foot
132kph, angled into leg stump, he glances this neatly to fine leg
140kph, good length, on off, he pushes to cover
shorter and flatter, he's back and punching with ease to long on
drifting into leg, he's back and tucking this off the hip to square leg
fuller outside off, he drives with a lavish flick to long off
89kph, tossed up, on off, he pushes this to cover-point
shorter and wider of off, he's back and dabbing a nice late cut past slip but only gets one
tossed up outside off, he reaches forward and defends
tossed up, he plays a lovely inside out drive through cover to deep mid off
sharp spinning leg break down leg, he misses out on tucking it fine
faster on middle, he steps forward and defends

huge lbw appeal as he tries to paddle sweep. Pakistan review. They ran as it went to short fine. He went to lap sweep. And he's hit it clearly onto pad. Clear hot spot. Not out. Pakistan burn a review.
big ripping leg break, beats him as he goes back. But it spun so far away from the bat there was never any danger
fuller outside off, he pushes to point
tossed up outside off, he defends on the front foot
flatter on off, he pokes this to the gap at cover-point
tossed up on leg, he works this to midwicket
shorter length on leg, he's back and working this to square leg
tossed up on leg, he sweeps neatly to deep backward square
drifting into off, he leans forward and defends

should have been run out! Wow this was suicide from Labuschagne. He worked it the sweeper at forward square and took on Imam, he got there easily but the throw was wide of Rizwan! Labuschagne was cooked
flatter on off, he defends on the front foot
leading edge trying to whip against the turn, it rolls safely to a gap at point
swept powerfully to fine leg! Bad ball down leg and gets down and hammers this to fine leg, the deep backward square stood no chance
driven beautifully past mid off! Back to back 150s for Warner. Supreme stroke to bring it up, against the turn, driving hard past mid off.
short down leg, he's down on one knee and pulling to deep backward square
tossed up on off, he presses on the front foot to cover
good length on off and he defends
shorter outside off and he leaves
tossed up, a bit of turn, he gets a thick outside edge defending, it runs to short third man and a misfield allows two
drifting down leg, he's back and works it through square leg
shorter on leg, he's back and working this to square leg
sweeps powerfully from off stump, to deep backward square and a great diving stop saves a boundary
fuller on middle, he works it with the spin off the front foot forward of square
tossed up outside off, he drives to cover, a diving stop knocks it down but they get one
90kph, full on middle, he whips firmly to deep midwicket
shorter length, outside off, he's back and working this from outside off, wide of mid on
leg break spinning down leg, he just bunts it around the corner
tossed up, he drives firmly to long off
pitched outside leg, he's taken on the pad trying to whip, they appeal in hope but it's fruitless
tossed up on off, he's defending on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and working this through square leg
shorter, he's back and punching this to deep cover-point
tossed up on off, he's forward and defending
129kph shorter outside off, he sways inside it
135kph, full and wide, he square drives on the front foot past gully along the ground! Too easy for Warner
139kph, good length, but well wide of off, he leaves
142kph, good length on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover-point
139kph, good length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending watchfully
good length, 137kph, top of off, he's back and defending
round the wicket, pushed down the leg side and Warner misses his sweep
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
short outside off, poor delivery, Warner leans back and drives it wide of cover
worked away from off stump into midwicket
over the wicket, full at off stump, defended
very full, dug out to the off side
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, steered through point with an open face and that's the 300-run stand
that's a good delivery but still costs a boundary, back of a length at off stump, squares up Labuschagne and the outside edge runs between slip and gully
short of a length outside off, neatly on the back foot he punches through the covers
touch fuller, better length, defended to cover
handsome stroke! Drives on the up, good stride forward, doesn't quite have the timing to reach the rope
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed to deep cover. Expensive start for Musa
gets across to off stump, works with the angle as he tucks to the on side
very full at off stump, driven to the cover sweeper
again he works this around the corner wide of short leg
good length at middle, he props forward
on off stump, stretches forward and defends
there's the whip through the leg side, fantastic wrists, this was a full delivery on off stump and it finishes up at deep midwicket
round the wicket, length on middle, defended
dragged down short, that's another freebie, pulled powerfully through midwicket
angled into the pads, nurdled through square leg
round the wicket, full outside leg, swept along the ground through short fine leg
on off stump, pushed to the bowler
terrific shot as he drives elegantly, but it's a good save by cover as he flings himself to his right
full at middle, defended on the front foot
uses his feet and lofts this over wide mid-on, a couple of bounces across the boundary...not entirely out of the middle
stays in his crease and defends coming forward
tight run! He uses his feet again, doesn't get to the pitch so pushes towards mid-on for a very dicey single
outside off, defended
touch wider outside off, Warner opens the face to nudge into a gap on the off side
worked off the stumps to midwicket
driven to the right of mid-off
tucks a straight delivery to square leg
down the pitch and ends up yorking himself
tossed up on leg stump, swept firmly to deep square leg
plays back, dabbed with an open face into point
cuts a short delivery to deep point
round the wicket, full outside leg, worked to deep square leg and that's back-to-back 150s
skips down the pitch and picks this up from outside off, a strong bottom-handed flick over midwicket
full outside off, defended
strides forward and drives through cover, but good running makes the second easily
short outside off, another bit of rubbish, Warner pulls it along the ground through square leg
short of a length outside off, square driven to point
back of a length at off stump, defended
delightful as he eases this through the covers off the back foot
fuller, outside off, defended to cover
angled into the pads, tucked into midwicket
round the wicket, worked off the pads to square leg
short of a length, straight, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket...that's the 350-run stand in the blink of an eye
over the wicket, full at middle, worked backward of square
short outside off, square drives through the off side wide of the sweeper
and again, short and wide, and the same result as it's square cut juts wide of a forlorn dive of the sweeper
and play and miss! Slightly fuller, Labuschagne aiming square through the off side and is beaten
floated up full outside off, driven firmly to cover
round the wicket, full outside off at 121kph, left alone
back of a length outside off, through to the keeper
hangs it outside off, Warner doesn't play...he'll be happy to leave a few alone with the new ball
good length outside off, defended to the on side
left alone outside off at 125kph
fuller, outside off, strides onto the front foot and punches firmly through the covers. A boundary away from 200
over the wicket, full outside off, left alone
through him! Afridi does it again with the new ball. Full at off stump, hint of shape back, Labuschagne goes for a big drive and loses off stump. That's a lovely delivery.
full outside off, Smith across the crease and pushes into midwicket
length ball on off stump, tucked through midwicket to take him to 199
good length outside off, played to the off side and a loud call of 'no'
there it is, Warner has a double! Works a length delivery into the leg side and lets out a huge roar
round the wicket, good length outside off, left alone
touch fuller, left alone
short of a length outside off, chopped into the pitch
fuller outside off, drives through the covers, almost leaning back a little on the shot
better delivery, full outside off, brings him forward and takes a thick inside edge
angled in at off stump, defended to the on side
nicely bowled, reckon Smith was beaten there by a delivery angled across outside off
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, played to the leg side
angled across outside off, a confident leave this time
back of a length outside off, 138kph, through to the keeper...can he make one come back?
pushed up fuller at off stump, met with a straight bat as Smith drives to mid-on
full outside off, driven very firmly to point who does well to intercept
good length at off stump, 123kph, defended
drops it on a length, defended carefully
gets across to off stump and tucks a straight delivery down to fine leg
full outside off, defended
across the stumps again, tickles this fine down the leg side and they make that into a three with more hard running
round the wicket, full outside off, defended
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
straight the stumps, Smith brings out the flick and sends it to fine leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short on leg stump, gets inside the line and tucks to long leg
full outside off, squirts off a thickish outside edge to point
threads the gap this time, a half volley outside off, driven between cover and mid-off
full outside off, defended
full at off stump, defended off a thickish inside edge to the leg side
worked from outside off into the leg side
full at off stump, 126kph, pushed back to the bowler
drops a length ball down by his feet for a sharp single
worked from outside off to the on side
back of a length outside off, defended to the off side
short of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
width outside off and he throws his hands through a square drive, that sounded terrific off the bat
a bouncer, haven't seen many of them, Warner ducks underneath
gives himself some room to the leg side and pushes a length delivery to cover
full at off stump, 121kph, a slower ball, defended to cover
good delivery, finds the outside edge from round the wicket but it runs wide of gully
gets squared up on off stump with a hint of seam movement, beats the outside edge and takes the back pad but well outside off stump
and again! He's getting it to nibble (at 2 for 400)...length ball on off stump, beats the edge again and takes him high on the leg
across onto off stump and nudges to the on side
gets well across outside off and takes a back-of-a-length ball to the on side
quite wide outside off, defended on the walk by Smith
short ball first up, and Warner swats it away past the square-leg umpire, and easily beats the boundary rider to his left
length ball on off stump, blocked to mid-off
back of a length on middle and off, makes room and jabs it away through point

beauty. Lovely length, bowled it a bit quicker. Warner could only get half-forward to defend, and he's a long way from the pitch of this delivery, which slides on with the angle to beat the outside edge
a bit slower, on off and middle, and he can hang back and defend it back to the bowler
on the pads, worked away through square leg
back of a length, angling into the stumps. Shuffles across and tucks it behind square on the leg side
good ball, straightens along the fifth-stump channel, and Warner shuffles across and defends into the cover point region

floated up full, close to off stump, and Warner pushes it towards mid-on. A bit of yes-no-yes, and Smith hares out of his crease before having to turn around and hare back. Dives into his crease, and Afridi's throw to the bowler's end misses the stumps anyway
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and defends down by his feet
down the track and he can't get close enough to the pitch of the ball angling in towards off stump. Looks to work it leg side, but only manages to get his pad to it
shortish, angling into Warner's hip. Looks to tuck it away fine, but can't get his bat round his body quick enough, and the ball pops into the square leg region off his thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, gets behind it and blocks into the on side
short, a bit of width, punched firmly but straight to point
fullish, close to off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
full outside off, driven to the left of cover, leans back and opens his bat face to find the gap
bouncer, Warner gets down low and sways his upper body away from the line
shot. Full, slanting away into a wide line outside off, nice use of the hands to manoeuvre that through cover point. Deep point is back on the boundary to keep it down to two
back of a length close to off stump, goes on the back foot and jabs into the covers
length ball outside off, fair bit of turn. Left alone
turn again, but the length is shortish. Goes back and stabs it to backward point
draws him forward now to defend, a bit of flight close to off stump
flighted again, on leg stump, gets his front pad out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler
good ball, slides on towards off stump from the shorter side of a good length. Goes back and defends into the on side

gone! But wait, no, he's overstepped! Full, fifth-stump line, and Warner doesn't get forward to drive, just throws his hands at it. Ends up slicing it straight to gully, at shoulder height, but umpire Illingworth's arm goes up straight away. What have you done, Mohammad Musa?
full again, on that wide-ish line. Throws his hands at it and slices it - along the ground this time - to gully
back of a length, angling into off stump, goes back and across to work it through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to tuck it through square leg and bring up the fifty stand
short and wide, slapped away to the left of deep point
bouncer, angling in from wide of the crease. Climbs to over head height, and Warner watches it all the way, leans back as he jumps off his feet, and ramps it gently over slip
back of a length on off stump, tucked away into the square leg region
tossed up on off stump, clipped down to long-on

shot! Labuschagne scored a lot of runs with this shot off Yasir, and now Smith shows he's just as good at it. Flighted ball, a touch too full on off stump, and Smith whips it away between mid-on and midwicket
nice flight, a better length on off stump, stretches forward and blocks it back to the bowler
short, wide, punched to sweeper cover
full, slanting away from off stump. Warner is hurried into a front-foot defensive, and the ball slides into the leg side off the inner half of the bat

big shuffle across, and a long, lonely shout for lbw from the bowler. Was looking to work it leg side, and the ball spun past his inside edge and hit his pad. Or was there a bit of bat on it? The ball rolls into the backward square leg region, and there's no leg-byes signal. Pakistan choose not to review
beauty, and Musa oversteps again. Angled in towards off stump, hits a lovely length that brings Warner half-forward in defence, and straightens off the seam with extra bounce to beat the outside edge
length ball on middle and off, clipped watchfully to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and across and blocks it back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, defended to cover
back of a length on middle stump, rides the bounce and plays it down to midwicket with a turn of his wrists
on the fuller side of a good length this time, angling into middle and off. Defended into the covers
shortish on middle and off, gets off his feet to ride the bounce and defends with soft hands
Yasir drifts one helpfully down the leg side, and Smith moves past Bradman with a little flick round the corner through backward square leg
nicely bowled, a bit of drift in towards off stump. Stretches out and whips to mid-on
some drift again, but overpitched on this occasion, on off stump. Whips it forcefully, and Imam dives left at midwicket to stop a possible boundary
flat and quick, straightens towards off stump, stays on the back foot and blocks it back to the bowler
good ball, a bit of quick turn from an off-stump line, towards the pads. Worked behind square for one

squared up. Lovely ball, flat and quick, but on a good length on middle and leg. Smith plays the trajectory rather than the length and goes back to work it into the leg side. Turns sharply and rolls into the backward point region off the outside edge
another no-ball. Length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball, fourth-stump line. Warner is halfway forward to try and push into the point region, ends up getting a thick outside edge that runs away quickly to the left of slip
good bouncer, quick and angling in over leg stump. Warner ducks quickly to let it pass over his back
on the fuller side of a length, close to off stump. Warner is stuck in his crease again, shuffles across and uses his hands and wrists to steer it through point

short over off stump, gets up to chest height, Smith pulls it through backward square leg to bring up 7000 Test runs. He's now the quickest to the mark, going past Walter Hammond who got there in 131 innings. This is Smith's 126th innings
shortish on off stump, gets behind it and works it through square leg
length ball on off stump, gets forward and clips to mid-on
nicely bowled, length ball angling across to off stump and straightening back. Gets on the front foot and blocks into the covers
leg-stump line now and Warner brings out a controlled reverse-sweep to deep backward point
flat length ball on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
flighted but too full on middle stump, whipped away to the right of midwicket
length ball straightening towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
on the pads now, nudged down to long leg
shortish on off stump, climbs to his toes and defends into the point region

again that vulnerable area for Warner. A fullish length, fairly wide of off, and he throws his hands at the ball without getting a front-foot stride in. Thick edge, flies high between the lone slip fielder and gully
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball, fifth-stump line, shuffles across and defends into the point region
back of a length, wide of off stump. Goes hard at the cut and misses - didn't really move his feet there
back of a length, fifth-stump line, gets across and jabs to point
floated up close to off stump, stretches out to defend back to Yasir
flatter now, on off stump, gets forward and blocks it straight back
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs to backward point
tossed up, drifts in towards middle and leg, clipped to the right of midwicket
flighted nicely on middle and leg, not as full as the previous ball. Gets forward to defend to midwicket
too full again, outside off, but the line doesn't matter when it's overpitched. Smith brings his wrists into play again to whip it to the right of midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
length ball, fifth-stump line, gets on the front foot and eases it to point
back of a length, nips in off the seam from outside off, but it's short enough for Warner to watch onto his bat and defend towards point
length ball outside off, left alone

another edge through that region. Half-forward to a length ball outside off - he wants to push into the covers, ends up nicking it thickly instead. Into the gap to the right of gully, and that brings up Warner's 250. Second time he's done that in Test cricket

ooh, past the edge. Warner's looked a little scratchy in these last 15 minutes or so, and he pushes at this ball, straightening from a fifth-stump line, with no footwork or conviction. Wonder if he's tiring a little
length ball on the pads, goes back and works it through square leg
length ball on off stump, gets forward and clips to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
down the track, gets too close to the pitch of the ball to whip it into the leg side. Jams down on it and hits it back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, clipped to midwicket
down the leg side, swept to the left of long leg
length ball on off stump, hangs back and blocks it back to the bowler
on middle stump, now, clipped to the left of midwicket
fullish, angling into off stump, blocked towards midwicket
bouncer, Smith ducks under it
good ball, back of a length, jags back in from a wide-ish line outside off. Smith leaves it alone, having shuffled across to cover his stumps
length ball fairly wide outside off, Smith leaves it with a trademark swish across his body

wrong'un, starts outside leg and from a shortish length. Worked behind square, and there's an appeal for run-out as Warner dives to complete his second run, and replays show that the dive has saved him
sharp turn, but it pitches on leg stump and turns well down leg, past the attempted back-foot flick
fuller, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
flat legbreak on a leg-stumpish line, clipped to midwicket
flat wrong'un, pitching outside leg and giving away the bowler's intentions. Still, Warner is hurried into a back-foot defensive
floated up slower, on middle stump, and Warner brings out the reverse-sweep - no slip in place, so he had a lot of space to exploit behind point
full outside off, driven into the covers
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling in from wide of the crease towards off stump. Jumps across to clip to midwicket
fullish, fifth-stump line, left alone
fullish, angling into off stump, gets forward and blocks into the covers
fullish offcutter close to off stump. Defended back to the bowler, and that will be tea
over the wicket, full at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
on off stump, dabbed away
worked off the stumps to the leg side
flicks a full delivery down the ground to long-on
appeal for an edge behind! Given not out. No review. Was a lovely delivery, spins away on off stump, clips the back pad through to Rizwan
comes well forward and defends
full outside off, left alone, as Afridi resumes the toil
in the same spot outside off, Warner shoulders arms
back of a length outside off, 132kph, defended to cover
fuller, a half volley, he latches on with another crisp drive wide of mid-off
drags the length back a touch, left alone
length delivery outside off, pushed to cover
full and straight, driven to long-on
that's a fantastic stroke, full on leg stump, a very strong whip off the toes and it races through square leg...toying with the field
tucked into the leg side
too short, Warner has plenty of time to go back and square drive through the covers
defended on the back foot
short outside off, square cut through the off side, Imam makes good ground to save the boundary
he's edged behind having a big swing! Round the wicket, a full delivery outside off, Smith aiming a huge hoick over the leg side and gets a thin inside edge to the keeper
over the wicket, good length at off stump, defended
touch fuller, Wade is well across the crease and defends down the pitch

another appeal for caught behind, it's given not out. At the last moment they review. Afridi was confident but there wasn't much support. Nice delivery, in the channel outside off, Wade comes forward. The bat certainly hits the pad. Nothing on Snicko
keeps it full outside off, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, defended to backward point. Good over
over the wicket, good length on middle, defended
a touch short, dragged out to deep midwicket
gets the front pad right across and tucks the delivery to short leg
fuller and straighter, swept to deep square
defended to the leg side
on middle and leg, defended
gets squared up and a leading edge flies into the off side but falls short of point, Wade was looking to work a short-of-a-length delivery to the leg side
full outside off, worked to mid-on...you can see middle and leg stumps behind him
good length outside off, again he's right across the crease playing into the on side
this time he moves so far across all three stumps are exposed behind him, drives a full delivery to cover
full outside off, defended to backward point
nicely bowled, good length outside off, runs off the outer part of the bat wide of second slip to third man
worked off the pads to square leg
that's a strong sweep, picked up from leg stump, goes in the air for a while but placed well wide of deep square
dabbed away square on the off side, set off wanting the second but it's no there
comes down the pitch and drags a delivery from outside off through midwicket, not quite off the middle and there's cover in the deep
stays in the crease this time, worked from outside off to short fine leg
turned off the pads behind square
he's driven so well in this innings and this is another, cashing in on a half volley which he places perfectly through the covers
pulls the length back, pushed to the covers
left alone outside off
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
pushes square towards point, always looking for the run but the field is in sharply enough
flicked from outside off between midwicket and mid-on
defended to the on side
driven to mid-off who is deep enough for a comfortable single
that's a long hop and it's way back into the stands over deep midwicket as Wade rocks back and hammers it. First proper six of the match
and now he's down the pitch, clipped off the pads to deep square
tapped to the on side
tucked to short fine leg
floated outside off, left alone
round the wicket, worked to midwicket
tapped from outside off to the on side
back of a length outside off, defended
shorter outside off, gets nicely over the top and steers it through backward point
top shot! Wide half volley, Wade comes forward and drills it through the covers
round the wicket, short, a superbly-timed bottom handed shovel through midwicket takes him into the 290s
drives a full ball back to the bowler
short outside off, timed sweetly with a punchy drive off the back foot wide of the cover sweeper
gently floated up outside off, driven into the covers
full at the stumps, defended
steps away towards leg and drives to cover

there's his triple century! Gets a short ball from Abbas outside off, connects well with the pull and sends it wide of mid-on. Huge emotion on Warner's face. Another leap, we've seen a few of those this innings
left alone outside off...how much further can he go?
fuller, outside off, left alone
comes forward and drives to cover
pushed across wide outside off
another one through to the keeper as Warner resets
round the wicket, driven to cover
short outside off, cut strongly through point
pushed into the off side
down the pitch, takes this from outside off down to long-on
pushes into the off side
very wide on the crease, Warner rocks back to a short delivery and plays out to deep cover
tucks a straight delivery just to the left of mid-on
goes huge and high into the leg side, walked right across the stumps and swung hard, lands into space
into the stands over deep midwicket. Short of a length, Warner leans back and lets rip with a mighty pull
edge over slip, has a big swing at a full delivery outside off, gets away with it down to third man
stand and deliver...carves through the line of a length ball to deep cover. Intentions are clear now
short of a length, helps it out to deep square
full on off stump, swept away into the vast spaces behind backward point
flat length ball on off stump, looks to defend into the on side and gets a thick outside edge into the point region
flat and full on the pads, clipped into the vacant wide mid-on region. All the fielders in that direction are on the boundary
shuffles down the pitch to the off-stump ball, drives punchily to extra-cover
bam. Flat sweep from an off-stump line, easily beats deep midwicket to his left
length ball speared in towards leg stump, goes on the back foot to nurdle into the midwicket region
short outside off, gets up to head height, Warner plays a tennis-style swat to the left of mid-on
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and steers to the left of third man
shortish in the corridor, shuffles across and jabs to point
full outside off, driven to the sweeper at deep cover point
shortish, angling into the hip, whipped away to long leg
in the blockhole outside off, stabbed to point with an open face
length ball close to off stump, gets forward to defend and gets a thick outside edge to backward point
tossed up on middle stump, and was that a reverse-sweep or a switch hit? In either case, he's unable to get it past the man at backward point
flat length ball on off stump. Makes room to cut, can't manufacture enough to squeeze it past point
on the pads, clipped into the vacant midwicket region
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
flat, back of a length, angling down leg. Misses the pull, rolls away off the pad to the left of short fine leg. Could have been bottom edge too
full outside off, driven firmly but too close to the man at extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg to move past Michael Clarke and Inzamam-ul-Haq's 329
shortish in the fifth-stump channel, defended to point
length ball on off stump, Wade plays a checked drive to cover

back of a length on off stump, shuffles a long way across to tuck it into the square leg region. There's a direct hit at the keeper's end from the diving midwicket fielder - an underarm flick - but Warner is well home, and Australia gratefully take the overthrows
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
tossed up slow and Warner skips out of his crease to clip to the right of deep midwicket
flat length ball on off stump, whipped to deep midwicket to equal Graham Gooch's 333
full on middle and leg. Looks to drive down the ground, rolls off the inner half of the bat to deep midwicket
flat, back of a length, on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket to draw level with Don Bradman and Mark Taylor
full close to off stump, driven to the right of long-off

tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover, and Mark Taylor rises to his feet to applaud as David Warner sweeps past his highest Test score. Only Matthew Hayden is ahead of Warner now, among Australian batsmen. And Warner will finish on 335, as Australia signal the declaration
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, a little closer to off stump now, and he gets it to straighten and climb steeply off the surface. Shan has a little feel for it, and he's lucky not to edge it

big lbw appeal as the ball goes past the edge of Shan Masood's bat with the batsman defending from the crease. Bat was coming down at an angle, from around gully, and he ended up playing across the line, and the ball beat his outside edge to hit back pad. Probably too high
length ball, angling down leg. Beaten for pace looking to flick, he's hit on the pad again
length ball on off stump, lets it come to him and defends into the on side

another huge lbw appeal, and this one's given. Umpire Illingworth has no hesitation. Fuller on this occasion, and it looked plumb at first glance, but Masood has reviewed it. No stride forward, and again Masood is playing across the line, bat coming down from gully and he's looking to play that towards midwicket. The ball straightens past his outside edge, but, but, but... but there's a tiny Hotspot on the outside edge, so it's juuust scraped his bat. Masood lives on, just about

huuuge appeal first up, but Michael Gough isn't interested. Can he be pitching in line from over the wicket to the left-hander? Australia think he can be - they've reviewed this. No edge, Imam's feet stuck in the crease and his bat pushing at the ball a long way in front of his body as it straightens in off the pitch. It's pitched just outside leg stump, though, so he'll survive and Australia will lose a review
back of a length on middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
full on off stump, defended towards mid-off
length ball on off stump, looks to defend down the ground but the ball straightens a little and hits the inside half of his bat, rolls into the square leg region

again Imam is playing hesitantly from the crease as a fullish ball straightens into him slightly. Looks to push down the ground, ends up playing it to the right of square leg off the inside half of the bat. Takes the quick single to get off the mark

beauty. Cummins has been getting everything to come back gently into the left-hander. This one keeps going with the angle across, and along a tight line that forces Masood to play. Does well to play close to his body and let himself get beaten rather than pushing his hands at it
squared up. Back of a length, straightening away from a middle-and-off line. Looks to defend with his bat coming down at an angle, and gets a thick outside edge to backward point
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone, and Paine collects over his head as the ball springboards off the surface
back of a length, wide of off, left alone
back of a length, straightening slightly towards off stump, Imam is nicely behind it to defend
bouncer, rising to about neck-height as it passes the batsman over off stump. Well played by Imam, sways his upper body away from the line while keeping his eyes locked on the ball
excellent leave. Back of a length, close to off stump, and it doesn't miss off stump by much in terms of line, but I guess Imam left it on length, trusting the bounce off this surface
shortish, at Masood's hip. Comes at him from his blind spot outside leg stump, and hits him on the thigh pad as he gets on his toes and tries to tuck it into the leg side
another excellent leave. Not too far outside off, but Cummins is angling it across him from over the wicket, and so far hasn't shown any signs of extravagant movement against that angle
full on off stump, jams his bat down and clips to the left of mid-on
full, slanting across into the fifth-stump channel. Dangled it up for the drive but Imam resists the bait
shot. Overpitched, on off stump, and he shows the full face to drive to the right of mid-on
length ball, angling into the fifth-stump channel, left alone

digs this in and gets it to climb sharply towards Imam's neck region. Jumps up and fends at it, and he's lucky the ball doesn't pop in the direction of a fielder off his glove. Drops down by his feet instead. Did well to drop his bottom hand, to give him some credit
back of a length, not far outside off, and in fact it soars over the off bail after Imam leaves it. Again, a leave on length. Well played

gone, that's such a good ball from Starc. Imam had to play at this. Length ball, angling in towards off stump and straightening just a touch. Squares up in defence, and the thick edge goes to Warner at fourth slip/fine gully, at hip height. He should probably have been on the front foot to that ball, and his bat was well in front of his body when he met that ball, but most batsmen take a little while to get their feet moving at the start of their innings, and this came to him at 150kph
back of a length, tails back in towards off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone. A bit of shape back in but not enough to go against the angle
length ball angling into the fourth-stump channel. Gets half-forward to defend towards backward point
full, close to off stump. Looks to drive down the ground, gets a thick inside edge to square leg thanks to the angle from round the wicket
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket

full, looks to be angling down leg, but a huge lbw appeal nonetheless after Masood misses his flick. No review from Australia after the umpire turns it down. Will have to see ball-tracking, but I thought it was missing leg. Anyway, it's now time for dinner.
full outside off, hint of shape back, left alone
good length outside off, 146kph, left alone
in the channel outside off, through to the keeper
fuller, Azhar gets onto the front foot and drives straight of mid-off...first runs conceded by Starc
touch too straight, on the pads, flicked away fine, long leg is very square but Cummins is able to get across
good length at middle, 145kph, defended to midwicket
round the wicket, good length outside off, a sighter for Masood
short of a length outside off, shapes back at the left hander with the angle, left alone
touch fuller at off stump, makes him play, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
full outside off, angles back towards off stump as Masood lets it go
nicely played, comes forward and drives through the covers, but Cummins won't mind that shot
full, targeting off stump, defended to the bowler. Probing over
good length at off stump, runs off the face wide of fourth slip
defended to the on side
shorter delivery, at the body, gets inside the line and nudges through square leg
fuller, outside off, met with a straight bat and punches back down the ground
short of a length, straight, played into midwicket
full outside off, good stride forward and defended to point...no massive movement early on
round the wicket, full outside off, 139kph, defended
full at off stump, played with a closed face into the leg side
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
hits the splice as Azhar defends a length delivery
fuller, outside off, defends on the front foot
too full, too straight and very nicely clipped through midwicket for the first boundary of the innings
short of a length, worked into the gap at midwicket
a bouncer which is comfortably ducked
length ball outside off, 146kph, left alone
fuller, left alone as it's pushed across
goes for the yorker, at off stump, jabbed towards fourth slip off the toe of the bat
wider outside off, this does on the way towards Paine
over the wicket, full at off stump, defended to mid-on
touch of uncertainty this time as a length delivery runs off the face of the bat, but safely into the ground towards the slips
angled across outside off, left alone
short ball outside leg stump, gets nicely over the top of it and pulls to long leg
good length outside off, 139kph, defended firmly to the covers

taken low at second slip! This will go to the third umpire, but looks good. Soft signal is out. A good length delivery at middle and off, squared up Azhar, who slices across the delivery, and the edge flew low towards Smith who has got fingers under the ball as he comes forward. That's a good catch.
tucked through the leg side
very full outside off, left alone
back of a length, straight, worked into midwicket
good length at off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, 136kph, left alone
left alone again, more carry on this one through to Paine. A steady opener from Hazlewood
a very crisp stroke as he clips this off the toes through square leg
a shorter delivery on off stump, well played, dropped into the off side for a quick single
top shot, drives a full delivery straight of mid-off for another boundary
beaten by a good one just outside off, nibbles off the seam to beat the edge. Nicely bowled
defended to the off side
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended
round the wicket, short outside off, a slightly half-hearted pull which he isn't far from spooning to mid-on
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
gets forward to a full one outside off, bat face closes a touch as he drives to mid-on
gets squared up outside off, back of a length, the outside edge runs safely to backward point
back of a length, takes an inside edge and the sticks behind the flap of his pad
beaten by a crackerjack from around the wicket, pitches full outside off, nips away to beat the outside edge
another beauty which nibbles past the outside edge, back of a length at off stump, the batsman had to play
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended to the covers
full at off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
well played, gets forward and latches onto a half volley which he drives through the covers
full and straight, worked to midwicket
length ball outside off, 136kph, defended towards backward point
back of a length outside off, an outside edge, but reasonably controlled, and it ends up at Warner in the gully
fuller, outside off, left alone
a bouncer outside off, Masood sways out of the line
full, outside off, through to the keeper
full outside off, across the crease and defends to mid-on

edged, caught behind! Lovely bowling, probing away from round the wicket, this is a good length outside off, brings Masood forward, just feeling for it as it angles in then straightens a fraction off the seam
back of a length outside off, left alone
at off stump, defended at the top of the bounce
fraction shorter, Babar hangs back and defends square into the off side
touch straighter, allows him to tuck into space at midwicket
full, angling down the leg side, clips the pad and Paine sprawls to his left
edged, wide of third slip! A very full delivery, Shafiq pushing forward, healthy edging but just out of reach of Labuschagne. Might not quite have carried, either
full at off stump, Babar caught a little on the crease but defends solidly enough to cover
good length outside off, defended
lovely shot, gets forward and pulls out a cracking drive which beats mid-off
pulls the length back, pushed into the covers and that's a well-judged single
defended to the off side
full at the stumps, defended
good length outside off, 138kph, left alone...lengthy spell for Cummins, although split by the break
back of a length outside off, defended to the covers
a bouncer outside off, lets it go through
feeling for this a touch outside off, short of a length, not much footwork but keeps it to ground through backward point
full at off stump, 137kph, defended on the front foot
edged, did that carry to slip? Don't think it reached Wade. Back of a length outside off, a tentative push
short of a length, nips back a little, defended on the back foot
oh, top notch! That's Babar at his best. Good stride forward and a lovely cover drive. Could watch those all day
straighter delivery and this is a superb piece of timing off the pads through square leg
back outside off, full, left alone
a short ball over middle and off, ducks underneath
short of a length at off stump, worked into midwicket
over the wicket, full at off stump, defended to cover
beats the outside edge with one angled across, although it was probably wide enough to leave in the end. But always the danger of the one that comes back
tight on off stump, push-and-run into the covers
back of a length outside off, steered through the off side to deep point...curious to see him in place
full at middle and off, 145kph, defended
clipped off the pads to square leg
back of a length outside off, nips back in to beat the inside edge as Babar goes for the back-foot punch
back of a length, straightens towards off stump. Gets back and across and defends close to his body
too full on middle stump, and Babar clips it away effortlessly through the vacant midwicket region
length ball outside off, left alone. Seamed back in but started wide enough outside off to not bother Babar unduly
bouncer over middle and off, well directed and well evaded, Babar ducks low and gets under it
ouch. Back of a length on off stump, and he defends it off the back foot, down into the pitch, and the ball bounces back up and hits him on the chin. No major damage, though
full on middle and off, slanting across from left-arm over. Driven to short extra-cover
full and wide, inviting the drive away from the body, and Shafiq goes for it, leaning back as he plays the shot, and he's lucky that this thick edge flies between third slip and gully

got him, that's loose from Shafiq. This is a good-length ball, slanting away into the fifth-stump channel, and Shafiq had no need to play at that. Especially not if he was playing that in-between shot, neither attacking nor defending, just hung his bat out and exposed his outside edge. Healthy edge through to Tim Paine
greets him with a bouncer over leg stump, and he only gets enough time for an awkward half-crouch to get himself out of the way
length ball, pitching outside off and slanting further away, inviting the drive away from the body. Iftikhar leaves it alone
shortish on middle and leg, gets on his toes and plays it down into the square leg region
fullish outside off, eased towards point with an open face
bouncer over middle stump, Babar ducks under
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side

shot. Full, angling in towards off stump. Babar shows it the full face and punches down the ground, making the non-striker jump away from the ball in a hurry. Played slightly early, and hit it briefly in the air, but struck it sweetly enough
shot. Fullish outside off, and Iftikhar leans on a crisp drive through cover point, on the up

ooh, that's another well-directed bouncer, rising head high over off stump. Began to duck, but realised he would be putting his head in the way of the ball if he did that, and then pulled his head hurriedly away from the line. Hazlewood tells him what he thinks about that leave before he walks back to get his cap
back of a length on off stump, gets on his toes for a push into the point region
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, opens his bat face to jab towards backward point. Played slightly away from his body, but he played it late and was in pretty good control of it
length ball close to off stump, stays stuck in his crease and defends with an open face towards point
short, slanting away into a wide line outside off, left alone
short, even wider than the previous one. Iftikhar has a big slash at it but he's too far from the line to make contact

beauty. Length ball, threatens to tail in towards off stump, but pitches and nips away instead. Again, no footwork from Iftikhar, and he pokes at it and gets a thick edge that bounces well in front of second slip
bouncer angling down leg, not the hardest one to evade for Babar
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently through point
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the on side

length ball angling into off stump from wide of the crease, gets on the front foot and defends into the covers. Seemed to have a lot of time between planting his front foot and making contact with the ball
another bouncer, again it's rising over the stumps - he hardly seems to waste one - and Babar ducks hurriedly under it
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended towards short mid-on
length ball, on off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
looks to induce the slash with a wide, shortish ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
short ball rising to chest height over off stump. Lets it come on and defends into the off side
there's the loose shot Starc has been looking to induce. Good length, pitching on or just outside off and slanting away. Goes for the on-the-up drive away from his body, and he's beaten by a long way
shortish on off stump, lets it come on and punches into the point region
shortish outside off, rocks back and slaps it to backward point
another slightly loose shot from Iftikhar, but he middles this one. Fullish outside off, not quite up there for the drive, but he gets on the front foot and hits on the up, through cover point

oh my. Bowls another in the same sort of area, fullish and wide, and he throws his bat at it a touch too early, and the bottom hand takes over, and he ends up hitting it back to the bowler instead of through the covers as intended
a touch shorter, similar line, left alone
length ball angling in from wide of the crease, towards off stump. Plays from the crease in defence, towards midwicket. Should have been on the front foot, ideally
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot and defends into the point region
full, angling across towards off stump, and Babar drives sweetly but straight to mid-off
shot. Short, angling across to finish just outside off. Stands tall and punches through cover. Met it with a diagonal bat but met it under his eyes
length ball close to off stump, hangs back, lets it come on, and dabs gently into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, dabbed gently to the right of backward point for another single
shortish on middle stump, gets on his toes and defends with soft hands into the off side
full, close to off stump, Babar plays a checked drive to mid-off
full, just outside off, nice stride forward and Labuschagne dives to his right at cover to intercept another Babar drive
back of a length, angling down leg, can't get bat to ball while looking for the fine glance
length ball, a bit of width, gets on the front foot and opens his bat face to steer it to the left of deep cover point
bouncer, angling in and climbing over leg stump. Babar ducks low and lets it pass over his back
back of a length, nips back in towards off stump. Goes back to defend and gets a bit of inside edge onto pad
fullish on off stump, stays back and defends to cover

short, wide, slashed, gone. This was coming, and it's happened exactly as Australia have planned. Iftikhar will wonder whether he made it too easy for them.
